intro: Plectritis samolifolia var. pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf plectritis, is a small, herbaceous annual plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its compact size and delicate appearance make it a notable species in its native range.
